bdglue2.utility.schemadef

Class SchemaDef

  • java.lang.Object
    • bdglue2.utility.schemadef.SchemaDef

  • public class SchemaDef
extends Object
    A simple tool for generating schema meta data files for the target environment. It reads the metadata for the specified tables from the source database via JDBC and writes out the schema files as appropriate. It is based on the idea that schema files have a beginning, middle, and end. "Beginning" opens things up; "middle" represents each of the fields; and "end" completes the schema and closes things out.

    Currently supported targets include:

    • Avro *.avsc files
    • Table creation scripts for Oracle NoSQL
    • Hive schema metadata for mapping HDFS files stored in Avro format as external tables in Hive.

      • numericEncoding

        public String numericEncoding()
        Determine how to encode fixed decimal types. "Double" is the default.
        Returns:
        the property that tells us how to encode numeric/decimal data.

      • setGG122TxInfo

        public void setGG122TxInfo()
                    throws IOException
        This is a hack specific to GG "out of the box" processing. It allows schemadef to be used to generate avro schema files in the format that GG uses.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a JSON format error occurs.

      • setBdglueTxInfo

        public void setBdglueTxInfo()
                     throws IOException
        Create columns for the transaction metadata information including operation type and/or the transaction timestamp, etc. The column names are specified in the properties file.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a JSON formatting error occurs

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws Exception
        Main entry point for this utility.
        Parameters:
        args - command line arguments. Not presently used.
        Throws:
        Exception - if one occurs

      • tables

        public String[] tables(String list)
        Generate an array of table names from a String.

        The input string contains a whitespace delimited list of table names.

        Parameters:
        list - the list of tables from the properties to process
        Returns:
        the list of schema.table entries
